title: [Serious thread] Is it even worth having AP champs anymore?
body:
With the powerful amour pen items and the rest of the upgraded AD ones, and the "soft as warm butter" turrets, what reason is there to pick any AP champs?
Trynd, Yas, Olaf, Vayne, Braum. or something like that as a team, what are the disadvantages of not having an AP? 

Yasuo/zed if they force you back once and get a good minion wave, its goodbye turret, but a Karthus just cant, and an early lead is getting ever more important, Late game champs like Yas, Zed and trynd have very strong laning phases atm, so an early lead is brutal to an opponent, especially with the new xp bull happening atm, where a karthus or xerath, even with a massive early lead cant take objectives anywhere near as effectively, and needs to force their lane opponent back several times before being able to take the turret, where a yas needs only 1 and a lucky minion wave. 

and with ADC's being ever stronger, tanky champs like braum/kench are all the rage and an AP struggles to deal with them as well, 
the only advantage is that an AP can quickly assassinate the ADC, but a zed/yas can do that just as effectiely, and isn't 100% useless afterwards.

I main Azir, and will always play him no matter the meta, and he because of his turret pushing skills and huge sustained damage, isn't so disadvantaged, the same goes for kayle and co. 
but i just cant see any reason to pick LB or Kassadin over Zed or Yasuo now, and god knows the last time i saw a malzahar or xerath, or even a ziggs, the little rat used to be everywhere, but now its been at least a month since i saw one.

dont get me wrong, i hate it, id rather there wasnt Yas/Zed/Trynd in every single game, but because of the current state of the game, it seems irrelevant to have AP champs when AD ones can rip through armour so easily now and turrets basically don't exist to them anymore.

replies.body:
yes. it's called damage diversity.
if you have a team that's all AD, what's to the stop the enemy picking champs like malph, taric, and rammus that do extremely well with armour stacking?
that's basically the only reason tho.
But with 100% crit on all ad champs and the huge armour pen items, it doesn't really matter how much armour you have.

People just like to play Zed, Yasuo and Tryndamere. AP mid is far from bad right now. Brand is a complete power house, and Anivia is extremely strong as well and Ahri is viable as always.

> i just cant see any reason to pick LB or Kassadin over Zed or Yasuo now

I can't see a reason for Kassadin either because he's trash teir, but LeBlanc has a much more powerful laning phase than any of the AD champs. If you have some experience on her you can dominate melee picks with range and constant harass, you also have enough mobility to juke when things get ugly.

I play nothing but ap, and my winrate is slowly going up this patch.

Just play bursty champs that have dps aswell, so for example i play alot of kayle and akali both of which have high burst but can still auto you down.
